channel.copyright: Copyright 2015 The New York Times Company

item.title: Ayatollah Khamenei, Backing Iran Negotiators, Endorses Nuclear Deal
item.description: The supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, voiced support for the deal while also saying it would not end the hostility between Iran and the United States.
item.dc:creator: THOMAS ERDBRINK
item.media:credit: Office of the Iranian Supreme Leader, via Associated Press
item.media:description: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei of Iran portrayed the nuclear deal favorably in a speech after a prayer marking the end of the Muslim fasting month Ramadan.

item.title: Andal Ampatuan Sr., Suspect in Philippine Massacre, Dies During Trial
item.description: Mr. Ampatuan, head of a political clan in Maguindanao Province, was accused of ordering an attack on a rival’s convoy that left 58 dead, many of them journalists.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: FLOYD WHALEY

item.title: China Releases 9 Tourists Accused of Watching Terrorist Video at Hotel
item.description: The nine, from South Africa, Britain and India, were being allowed to return home, according to the South African government and an aid group.
item.dc:creator: ANDREW JACOBS

item.title: Shinzo Abe’s Military Plan Draws Sharp Response From Readers
item.description: While some readers in Japan approved of Prime Minister Shinzo Abe’s plan to restore combat powers to the military, many others strongly objected.
item.dc:creator: HANNA INGBER
item.media:description: Protesters rallied outside Parliament in Tokyo on Friday to show their disapproval of Prime Minister Shinzo Abe’s plans for giving the Japanese military limited powers to fight in foreign conflicts.

item.title: World Briefing: Pakistan: Senior Political Officials Arrested in Karachi
item.description: Two senior officials with the Muttahida Qaumi Movement, the party that has dominated politics in Karachi for decades, were arrested Friday.
item.dc:creator: SABA IMTIAZ

item.title: In Argentina, an Anguished Anniversary for Jewish Center Bombing
item.description: Argentines filled the streets outside the rebuilt headquarters of the Jewish community center bombed 21 years ago. The bombing remains unsolved.
item.dc:creator: JONATHAN GILBERT

item.title: World Briefing: Iraq: Dozens Killed in Car Bombing at End of Ramadan
item.description: At least 50 people were killed in a suicide car bombing in a central marketplace in eastern Iraq on Friday.
item.dc:creator: OMAR AL-JAWOSHY

item.title: World Briefing: Israel: Netanyahu and Abbas Talk by Phone After Year
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel called his Palestinian counterpart on Friday on Eid-al-Fitr, the first time the two leaders have spoken in more than a year.
item.dc:creator: JODI RUDOREN

item.title: World Briefing: Chad: Fighting Near Nigeria’s Border Kills at Least 21
item.description: At least 19 suspected Boko Haram fighters and two Chadian soldiers were killed in fighting on Friday.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: World Briefing: Norway: Mass Murderer Is Admitted to University, Though Not to Spend Time in Class or on the Campus
item.description: Anders Behring Breivik, who is serving a prison sentence in solitary confinement for the mass murder of 77 people four years ago, won approval Friday to study at Oslo University.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: World Briefing: The Vatican: A New Use for the Pope’s Helipad
item.description: The Vatican signed an agreement on Friday to permit Rome’s pediatric hospital to use the Vatican’s helipad to transport emergency patients.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Young Medics Were Lured by Briton to Join ISIS
item.description: Sixteen British medical students and young doctors left for Syria to join the Islamic State this year, after being recruited by a British medical student at a university in Sudan, the BBC reported on Friday.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: KATRIN BENNHOLD

item.title: Saudi-Backed Forces Said to Wrest Aden, Yemen, From Houthis
item.description: The exiled prime minister, writing on Facebook, called it a “historic moment” and said his government would turn its attention to repairing the devastation.
item.dc:creator: SAEED AL-BATATI and KAREEM FAHIM

item.title: King Salman of Saudi Arabia Meets With Hamas Leaders
item.description: The meeting is the most striking example yet of the new king’s willingness to work with Islamist organizations that the kingdom has long considered foes.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and BEN HUBBARD

item.title: ISIS Has Fired Chemical Mortar Shells, Evidence Indicates
item.description: The development, which investigators said involved toxic industrial or agricultural chemicals, signaled a potential escalation of the group’s capabilities.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: C. J. CHIVERS
item.media:credit: Conflict Armament Research and Sahan Research
item.media:description: A 120-millimeter mortar shell struck fortifications at a Kurdish military position near Mosul Dam in June, causing several Kurdish fighters near where it landed to become ill.

item.title: 3 in France Accused of Plotting a Beheading at a Naval Base
item.description: The Paris prosecutor’s office said the young Frenchmen, who were arrested Monday, had been inspired by an ISIS video and contacts with a fighter in Syria.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: ALISSA J. RUBIN

item.title: CVS and Walmart Canada Are Investigating a Data Breach
item.description: The retailers temporarily shut down their online photo processing services to determine the extent of a possible credit card data breach.
item.dc:creator: HIROKO TABUCHI

item.title: Burundi President Presses On in Disputed Re-election Effort
item.description: President Pierre Nkurunziza is seeking a third term in Tuesday’s vote; his opponents maintain that he is not entitled.
item.dc:creator: MARC SANTORA
item.media:description: Supporters of President Pierre Nkurunziza at a rally in Cibitoke, near the border with Rwanda.

item.title: Turmoil Deepens in Brazil as House Speaker Splits From Dilma Rousseff’s Coalition
item.description: The announcement ratcheted up pressure on President Dilma Rousseff, who is facing calls for her ouster over a sweeping graft scheme at the national oil company.
item.dc:creator: SIMON ROMERO

item.title: Germany Risks Its Reputation With Idea of Greece Exiting Eurozone
item.description: The suggestion that Greece might be better off leaving the eurozone — and the German leadership’s aggressive, punishing tone — could erode the trust Germany has built in Europe, some analysts say.
item.dc:creator: STEVEN ERLANGER
item.media:description: Germans held a protest against a third Greek bailout outside the Parliament in Berlin, after lawmakers on Friday to another financial rescue for Athens.
